00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001.description: President Kennedy was the fastest random speaker in the world with upwards of 350 words per minute.

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002.description: In the average lifetime, a person will walk the equivalent of 5 times around the equator.

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000003.description: According to suicide statistics, Monday is the favored day for self-destruction.

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000004.description: There are two credit cards for every person in the United States.

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000005.description: Cats sleep 16 to 18 hours per day.

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000006.description: 1 in 5,000 north Atlantic lobsters are born bright blue.

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000007.description: Elephants are the only mammals that can't jump.

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000008.description: Odontophobia is the fear of teeth.

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000009.description: The first known contraceptive was crocodile dung, used by Egyptians in 2000 B.C.

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000010.description: The 57 on Heinz ketchup bottles represents the number of varieties of pickles the company once had.

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000011.description: Diet Coke was only invented in 1982.

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000012.description: In the early days of the telephone, operators would pick up a call and use the phrase, 'Well, are you there?'. It wasn't until 1895 that someone suggested answering the phone with the phrase 'number please?'

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000013.description: Mario, of Super Mario Bros. fame, appeared in the 1981 arcade game, Donkey Kong. His original name was Jumpman, but was changed to Mario to honor the Nintendo of America's landlord, Mario Segali
